data.title: Groupons are great door openers for restaurants- but not this time.
data.text:
So my friend had a Groupon for $30 worth the food. She had ate there before and promised that their oxtail ramen was pretty good. 

Well, it wasn't available during our visit so we settled on a bowl or ramen and a rice bowl. We figured we could share. Since the restaurant has a BYOB policy with no charge for uncorking, we had a bottle of red wine. 

The ramen was plain. It tasted like store bought ramen with roasted pork and an egg added. The rice bowl was better. Apparently the only difference between the small bowl and the large bowl is the rice amount. 

We asked the wait staff and she acknowledged the broth preparation method was different due to complaints of some people saying the flavor was too strong. 

As a ramen eater, the broth is the best thing in the bowl. It has to be flavorful and warm. Why the method was changed, I don't know. 

The wait staff changed out the ramen for another rice bowl. All in all the food wasn't worth the trip from the Bronx. I'll keep to NYC Ramen restaurants. The best part of everything was the roasted pork. The pieces were flavorful and moist. 

However- the staff if phenomenal. They are quick, they are friendly and accommodating. Although the food wasn't great, the staff earned their $10 tip.

data.title: Fantastic Ramen.
data.text: Don't be put-off by the nondescript storefront. They have excellent Tonkotsu Ramen. The staff is young but friendly. Will go back next time I am in town.

data.title: Good food, friendly staff, but a long wait!
data.text:
Got a groupon email on this and decided to try it out.  We went at 630; got seated in 10 minutes and ordered.  Got out food close to 730 pm. Almost an hour.  The place was not packed but it wasn't empty either so we decided that it was kinda acceptable- the wait time.  Food was good; not average but not spectacular. Would I go back for the food?  Absolutely!  Portion size are big.  We had the Gua Bao Buns which were delicious;  My wife had the chasu don which for her was just OK.  I had the tonkutso ramen which I found to be good although the noodle was a bit too firm.
It is hard to find street parking but the store is on a side street directly in front of New Roc center so you can park there, which we did.  By the way,  there is a bell in front which you ring if you like the food.  I was wondering what it was for. Everytime it rang, the owner would yell " thank you! "   We did not ring the bell because we did not know what it was for.  Only found out about it here on TA.
Note- the food is asian, the place has an asian name but the crew is not!
Tip-check groupon for a coupon.  It helps save a bundle!

data.title: Worth a trip....
data.text: Great food. Large portions  (even the small). Friendly staff and manager. Got a rice bowl and Ramen. Both were great. Conveniently located one block from the movie theater. Looking forward to our next visit.

data.title: Skeptical at First
data.text: My wife and I decided on this place while we waited for our hotel room to get ready. It's a small place with seating for about 20-25 including the bar. We were seated right away since it wasn't busy. As we sat there waiting for our order we were second guessing our choice. I didn't like the view of the dishwashing area and it really looked like the place could use a good cleaning. However when our food arrived we found our new focus. Our dumplings were very good, crispy crunchy on one side and soft and supple on the other. Then came the ramen. My curry chicken ramen was awesome. It was the perfect blend of curry and noodles. I think the owner, Wayne, and his staff have a diamond in the rough here. With a little fine tuning on the surroundings this place can really shine. Like the food already does.

data.title: My scape from work
data.text: Wayne and his team always know how to make you feel at home, the food is delicious, I love the Oaxtail and the pork buns are delicious, I strongly recommend this place, you will have so much fun and enjoy delicious food.

data.title: Good noodle soup and gluten free options too
data.text: We tried to get take out but it wasn't ready yet? So we ended up staying and had the noodle soup and a rice bowl. I would highly recommend the soup, it was delicious and very filling. The rice bowl seemed too little of the veggies but the soup was plentiful. They were very nice and I would definitely go back.

data.title: A hidden treasure awaits
data.text:
When I first walked in I wasn't sure what to expect. A mix of R&B, rock and some other types of music was playing, not exactly what you would expect in a ramen shop. It is a small place but can easily seat about 30. 

Enough of that, this is more about the food. Our waiter, who I believe is the owner and is very gracious. My wife and I started with pork dumping that were pan seared and covered with a light sauce with a hint of scallions and ginger which did not over power the pork in the dumpling. A nice way to start.

My wife ordered the special spicy rib tip ramen. She loved it so I had to taste it. There was an explosion of flavor in the broth. It was excellent. The ramen were just right. I had oyako-don. Grilled chicken over rice and eggs with onion scallions and ginger. The taste was delicious and well balanced you could actually taste each ingredient. I loved it. 

I'm planning on returning soon.

data.title: best Asian/Jamaican fusion ever!
data.text: Jerk Chicken Ramen, Curry Oxtail Ramen and curry chicken ramen all amazing. I have eaten here more times than I can count. Its not big enough to accommodate large groups though. Most entrees under $20 but you will still leave with a full belly.

data.title: The food was tasty and the room is nice
data.text: I went there with a friend for lunch and the waitstaff explained how the food worked, what we might order and the different variations available. What I didn't know is that the regular broth was porky and redolent of fat. Less than an hour after we left I got violently sick. Too bad, because the staff was great and the food was fresh and well-made.

data.title: Healthy food with a fun twist
data.text:
This is a fun, happening little restaurant with a Caribbean twist. Larger than life owner Wayne, an ex NYPD cop, is a charming host.
He combines healthy Japanese Ramen noodle soups with some Jamaican and Caribbean flavours in a unique and delicious way. 
It's right across from New Roc City. Highly affordable and recommended.

data.title: Not impressed at all
data.text: Son loves ramen and was bugging us to take him here. Unimpressive. Small........if you go with children you NEED to make a reservation or you will wait. Service was not great......asked for drink order 3 times..........it arrived after apps and after the entrees  had been served. Dumplings looked and tasted like the came out of the freezer section. Pork buns were AWESOME!!! Ramen was not that great.......really easier to say that then just pick it apart bit by bit. Will never come here again.

data.title: Try the braised pork belly over rice..
data.text:
Came here for lunch again on a weekday and sat again at the bar.  Ordered the ramen with the vegetable stock and Chashu-Don (braised pork belly over rice).  Enjoyed both dishes.  If you get the ramen, you might want to order add'l noodles to enjoy with the broth.

Side note: credit card machine wasn't working the day we were there, Nov. 30, so you might want to double check if that is how you want to pay.

user_location.name: New Rochelle, New York, United States

data.title: Fantastic!!!!
data.text: I've been to this restaurant at least 20x! It's my go-to spot for ramen in the area. They are very consistent which speaks to the quality of their food. I absolutely recommend Roc N Ramen!

data.title: Skip this Place
data.text:
Had lunch with my wife Feb 11. There were 11 people seated so it was not busy. Service was SOOOO SLOW The waiter missed part of our order. He then asked us if we "would like more water?" We responded that "we had not received any water!" Each order was made to order one at a time. The place was chilled each time the door opened. The view was the dishwasher doing his thing, very scenic! I did like the Rap music with lunch and noticed not one Asian Employee present.
This is pretend Asian food that is not worth the wait.

data.title: Welcoming and Warm
data.text: The ramen noodle is here to stay! Popping up in various locations throughout Westchester and here's another great find! Wayne gets it, he's friendly and makes it fun for the patrons. Delicious, rich, unctuous ramen 🍜 in a cozy convenient location. Ring the bell...thank you!

data.title: Very Good Food, Great Atmosphere
data.text:
Ramen Noodles and Asian Rice Dishes with a modern twist. Try the starters. You can bring your favorate wine BYO. Otherwise - or better - try the punch! Ring the bell on your table if you like the food. Nice crew.
Great atmosphere as long as you are not only into classic music. Classic Rock music fans will love this place. But the music is just at the right loudness.

data.title: So much fun!
data.text:
I purchased a Groupon for this restaurant since my family spends a lot of time visiting New Rochelle.  I can't say enough about how much fun we had.  The owner/staff are incredibly welcoming and warm.  Wayne spent a great deal of time chatting with our table.  I am sure the meal was not entirely heart healthy, but a good time was had by all!!

On the super positive side, Wayne honored my Groupon for the full amount even though it had expired.  Additionally, all drinks were comp.

data.title: Comfort food in a noodle bowl
data.text:
One of our party is a pork bun aficionado and we were looking for a place that had good pork buns. We googled "best in westchester" and Roc'n Ramen came up. Worth the drive to get there as the pork buns and the rest of the food did not disappoint. It was crowded but the owner immediately set about to find us room at the bar (view of the cooking area was fun btw.) The menu is limited but there are daily specials; everything we ordered was very good. Beer and sake available (but they were out of Japanese sodas.. argh!) 
To top off visit, the owner, Wayne, is outstandingly personable. He makes the visit and his staff provides excellent service. Lots of good eats in a casual place with nice staff and a warm welcome: doesn't get much better.

data.title: VERY GOOD
data.text: i was pleasantly surprised by the presentation and taste. when you see the name you are not sure what to expect. i had the veggie rice bowl and the seaweed salad and i enjoyed them both.  give it a try.
